context: It doesn't matter what I believe.

context: Now, you will be relieved, I hope, to learn that we didn't mean it and that both institutions are still open for business.
response: So, good bye everybody, and remember please, for the next day or so, the terrible lesson you learned tonight.
context/0: We annihilated the world before your very ears and utterly destroyed the Columbia Broadcasting System.
context/1: Starting now, we couldn't soap all your windows and steal all your garden gates by tomorrow night, so we did the next best thing.
context/3: The Mercury Theatre's own radio version of dressing up in a sheet and jumping out of a bush and saying, boo!
context/4: This is your host, ladies and gentlemen, out of character to assure you that "The War Of The Worlds" has no further significance than as the holiday offering it was intended to be.
context/7: It oughtta be on every station in the world.
context/8: Well, I don't get it.
context/9: We haven't heard anything about it.

context: Lived next door to him for five years now.
response: Very quiet, dependable sort of fellow.
context/0: Did you know him at all well?
